metadata.titleEn: Data of plant DNA in surface sediments of 33 lakes in Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau and arid northwestern China
metadata.titleCn: 青藏高原与西北干旱区33个湖泊表层沉积植物DNA数据
metadata.description: The data include raw sequencing result of plant DNA in surface sediments of 33 lakes in the Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau and arid northwestern China. We used PowerMax Soil Kit of Qiagen company in Germany to extract DNA, then used universal plant primer g-h (Taberlet et et al., 2007) to amplify P6 loop of chloroplast trnL (UAA) intron in the sample. The PCR products were then sent to Fasteris company in Switzerland for the next-generation paired-end sequencing. The sequencing instrument is Illumina Nextseq 550. The data quality score (Q30) is 81.97.
metadata.descriptionCn: 数据包括青藏高原与西北干旱区33个湖泊表层沉积物中植物DNA的原始测序文件。我们使用德国Qiagen公司的PowerMax土壤试剂盒提取DNA，并采用通用植物引物g-h (Taberlet et al., 2007) 对样品中叶绿体trnL (UAA) 内含子区的P6环进行PCR扩增，PCR产物随后送至瑞士Fasteris公司进行第二代高通量双端测序，测序仪器为Illumina NextSeq 550。数据质量分数Q30为81.97。
metadata.instructions: The data is fastq file. It is recommended to use obitools and other bioinformatic tools to read and analyze the data. Please refer to https://datadryad.org/stash/dataset/doi :10.5061/dryad.k6djh9w4r.
metadata.instructionsCn: 数据为fastq文件，建议使用OBITOOLS等生物信息学工具进行读取并分析，具体可参考：https://datadryad.org/stash/dataset/doi:10.5061/dryad.k6djh9w4r。

Biodiversity Data Journal 8: e57089. https://doi.org/10.3897/BDJ.8.e57089

background: Arctic and high-elevation ecosystems are very sensitive to natural and anthropogenically-induced climate variability. Anthropogenic warming and changes in land-use have been considered to shift vegetation composition and plant richness in these areas during the last centuries and decades. Modern plant sedDNA data, as a modern training-set, can be applied to reconstruct past vegetation types in alpine and arctic ecosystems, which in pollen-based reconstruction, can be largely biased due to the presence of poor modern pollen analogues. Since the last decade, plant sedDNA have been applied to lake surface-sediment samples to identify modern plant communities and to lake sediment cores to reconstruct local plant diversity changes in the past. Typically, plant sedDNA is retrieved by a metabarcoding approach that utilises the g/h primers that amplify a short fragment of the trnL P6 loop of the plant chloroplast genome. The P6 loop markers have been widely applied for the identification of plants in lake sediment samples and other environmental samples, such as soils, permafrost, and mock samples. For lake sediments, the use of P6 loop markers allows an identification of plants to a low taxonomic level and the recognition of more taxa from the local lake catchment. As plant diversity obtained from lakes' sedDNA reflects local plant communities, it is more suitable to reconstruct the past local plant diversity.
research objective: This study investigates modern plant diversity applying a plant-specific metabarcoding approach on sedimentary DNA of surface sediment samples from 262 lake localities covering a large geographical, climatic and ecological gradient.
challenges: There is a lack of understanding how environmental variability shaped local plant diversity in these remote areas. Until now, we have only a limited understanding of how environmental conditions influence the preservation of the plant sedDNA proxy which requires larger sedDNA datasets spanning a wide range of environmental conditions to be investigated.
methods: DNA extraction of surface sediment samples was carried out in the molecular genetic laboratories for environmental genetics at Alfred Wegener Institute Helmholtz Centre for Polar and Marine Research. We ran separate PCR set-ups for each of the extraction batches, including a PCR negative control (NTC). We produced at least two PCR replicates of each sample, which were set up on different days. The four pools were sequenced using the external sequencing service (Fasteris SA, Switzerland). We analysed in total 262 lake samples, resulting in 688 PCRs, which divide into 553 sample PCRs and 135 PCRs of extraction blanks and NTCs.
dataset: The underlying modern dataset is a large sampling set covering a wide range of environmental conditions, which will provide an openly accessible data resource which can be used to address the effect of the environment on the preservation of the sedDNA proxy.
backgroundCn: 北极和高海拔生态系统对自然和人为气候变化非常敏感。人类引起的变暖和土地利用变化被认为在过去几个世纪和几十年中改变了这些地区的植被组成和植物丰富度。现代植物沉积DNA数据作为现代训练集，可以用于重建高山和北极生态系统中的过去植被类型，而基于花粉的重建由于现代花粉类比的缺乏而可能存在偏差。在过去十年中，植物沉积DNA已被应用于湖泊表层沉积样本，以识别现代植物群落，并在湖泊沉积核心中重建过去的地方植物多样性变化。通常，植物沉积DNA是通过一种元条形码方法提取的，该方法利用g/h引物扩增植物叶绿体基因组的trnL P6环的短片段。P6环标记已广泛应用于湖泊沉积样本和其他环境样本（如土壤、永久冻土和模拟样本）的植物识别。对于湖泊沉积，使用P6环标记可以将植物识别到较低的分类水平，并识别来自当地湖泊集水区的更多分类群。由于从湖泊沉积DNA获得的植物多样性反映了当地植物群落，因此更适合重建过去的地方植物多样性。
research objectiveCn: 本研究通过对262个湖泊地点的表层沉积物样本进行植物特异性元条形码分析，调查现代植物多样性，涵盖了广泛的地理、气候和生态梯度。
challengesCn: 在这些偏远地区，环境变异如何塑造当地植物多样性仍然缺乏理解。到目前为止，我们对环境条件如何影响植物sedDNA代理的保存仅有有限的了解，这需要更大范围的sedDNA数据集，涵盖广泛的环境条件进行研究。
methodsCn: 在阿尔弗雷德·韦格纳研究所海洋与极地研究中心的环境遗传学分子遗传实验室中进行了表层沉积物样品的DNA提取。我们为每个提取批次进行了单独的PCR设置，包括PCR阴性对照（NTC）。我们对每个样品至少进行了两个PCR重复实验，这些实验是在不同的日期进行的。四个样品池使用外部测序服务（瑞士Fasteris SA）进行了测序。我们共分析了262个湖泊样品，产生了688个PCR，其中包括553个样品PCR和135个提取空白及NTC的PCR。
datasetCn: 基础的现代数据集是一个涵盖广泛环境条件的大型采样集，将提供一个开放可访问的数据资源，可用于研究环境对sedDNA代理保存的影响。

Verification.QuestionEn: Is DNA extraction from surface sediment samples in this domain typically carried out using specialized kits?
Verification.QuestionCn: 在这个领域，从表层沉积物样品中提取DNA通常使用专门的试剂盒吗？

Verification.QuestionEn: Are P6 loop markers commonly used for identifying plant taxa in lake sediment samples?
Verification.QuestionCn: P6环标记在湖泊沉积样本中识别植物分类群时是否常用？

Verification.QuestionEn: Does the data collection approach include sequencing service from an external provider?
Verification.QuestionCn: 数据收集方法是否包括来自外部提供商的测序服务？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the DNA extraction for plant sedDNA datasets typically conducted using specialized soil kits, general DNA extraction kits, or other methods?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 植物沉积物DNA数据集的DNA提取通常是使用专门的土壤试剂盒、通用DNA提取试剂盒，还是其他方法进行的？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What challenges exist in understanding the preservation of plant sedDNA in various environmental conditions?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在理解植物sedDNA在各种环境条件下的保存时，存在哪些挑战？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method that ensures the preservation of plant sedimentary DNA in lake surface sediment samples?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一种数据收集方法的示例，以确保湖泊表层沉积物样本中植物沉积DNA的保存？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method is the extraction of DNA from surface sediment samples using a PowerMax soil kit, followed by a plant-specific metabarcoding approach that targets the trnL P6 loop of the plant chloroplast genome. This method involves using g/h primers for PCR amplification and high-throughput sequencing to ensure preservation and accurate identification of plant sedDNA from local lake catchments.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法是使用PowerMax土壤试剂盒从表层沉积物样本中提取DNA，随后采用植物特异性元条形码方法，针对植物叶绿体基因组的trnL P6环。这种方法涉及使用g/h引物进行PCR扩增和高通量测序，以确保从当地湖泊集水区中保存和准确识别植物沉积DNA。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge in creating a dataset spanning a wide range of environmental conditions for investigating environmental impacts on sedDNA preservation?
Example.QuestionCn: 创建一个涵盖广泛环境条件的数据集，以研究环境对沉积DNA（sedDNA）保存的影响时，面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge is the limited understanding of how environmental variability affects local plant diversity and the preservation of the plant sedDNA proxy. This requires collecting and analyzing large sedDNA datasets from diverse environmental conditions, which is essential to address how these conditions influence sedDNA preservation.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个挑战是对环境变异如何影响地方植物多样性和植物sedDNA代理的保护理解有限。这需要收集和分析来自不同环境条件的大型sedDNA数据集，这对于解决这些条件如何影响sedDNA的保存至关重要。

Example.QuestionEn: Provide an example of a research approach used to investigate modern plant diversity in remote lake areas using sedimentary DNA.
Example.QuestionCn: 提供一个研究方法的例子，用于利用沉积DNA调查偏远湖泊地区的现代植物多样性。
Example.AnswerEn: A research approach involves applying a plant-specific metabarcoding method on sedimentary DNA from surface sediment samples across 262 lake localities. This method utilizes PCR amplification with g/h primers and high-throughput sequencing to analyze plant diversity, offering insights into how environmental conditions shape local plant communities.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种研究方法涉及对来自262个湖泊地点的表层沉积物样本中的沉积DNA应用植物特异性代谢条形码方法。该方法利用g/h引物进行PCR扩增和高通量测序，以分析植物多样性，提供有关环境条件如何影响地方植物群落的见解。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of the DNA extraction methods used in sedimentary plant DNA data collection?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 沉积植物DNA数据收集中使用的DNA提取方法的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: PowerMax soil kit by Qiagen, molecular genetic laboratories, separate PCR set-ups for each extraction batch, PCR negative controls (NTC), at least two PCR replicates of each sample on different days.
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: PowerMax 土壤试剂盒由 Qiagen 提供，分子遗传学实验室，每个提取批次单独进行 PCR 设置，PCR 阴性对照（NTC），每个样本至少进行两次 PCR 重复实验，且在不同的日子进行。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific attributes of plant metabarcoding are utilized in the analysis of sedimentary DNA from lake samples?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 植物元条形码分析中利用了哪些特定属性来分析湖泊样本中的沉积DNA？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: universal plant primers g-h, trnL P6 loop of the chloroplast genome, identification of plants to a low taxonomic level, recognition of more taxa from the local lake catchment
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 通用植物引物G-H，叶绿体基因组的trnL P6环，将植物识别到较低的分类水平，识别更多来自当地湖泊集水区的分类群。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is a 'metabarcoding approach' in the context of sedimentary DNA analysis?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在沉积物DNA分析的背景下，什么是“元条形码方法”？
Definition.AnswerEn: A metabarcoding approach in sedimentary DNA analysis refers to a method that utilizes specific primers, such as the g/h primers, to amplify a short fragment of the trnL P6 loop of the plant chloroplast genome. This approach allows for the identification of plants in lake sediment samples and other environmental samples by targeting specific DNA regions, facilitating the reconstruction of past vegetation types.
Definition.AnswerCn: 沉积DNA分析中的元条形码方法是指一种利用特定引物（如g/h引物）扩增植物叶绿体基因组中trnL P6环的短片段的方法。这种方法通过靶向特定DNA区域，能够识别湖泊沉积样本和其他环境样本中的植物，从而促进对过去植被类型的重建。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'P6 loop markers' in plant DNA analysis?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在植物DNA分析中，“P6环标记”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: P6 loop markers refer to specific DNA sequences within the trnL (UAA) intron region of the chloroplast genome that are targeted in plant DNA analysis. These markers are widely used for the identification of plants in lake sediment samples due to their ability to identify plants at a low taxonomic level and recognize more taxa from the local lake catchment.
Definition.AnswerCn: P6循环标记指的是叶绿体基因组中trnL (UAA)内含子区域内的特定DNA序列，这些序列在植物DNA分析中被靶向。这些标记广泛用于湖泊沉积物样本中植物的鉴定，因为它们能够在较低的分类学水平上识别植物，并识别来自当地湖泊集水区的更多分类。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the DNA extraction methods used in the Qiagen PowerMax soil kit compare to those used in molecular genetic laboratories, such as the Alfred Wegener Institute, in terms of efficiency and reliability for plant sedDNA analysis?
Comparison.QuestionCn: Qiagen PowerMax土壤试剂盒中使用的DNA提取方法与阿尔弗雷德·韦格纳研究所等分子遗传实验室使用的方法在植物沉积DNA分析的效率和可靠性方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The Qiagen PowerMax soil kit is utilized for extracting DNA in the dataset related to Tibetan Plateau and Northwest Arid Region lakes, whereas the molecular genetic laboratories at Alfred Wegener Institute perform DNA extraction with separate PCR setups and multiple PCR replicates for reliability. Both methods share a focus on ensuring the quality and integrity of DNA samples, but the latter emphasizes controlled experimental setups and replication.
Comparison.AnswerCn: Qiagen PowerMax土壤提取试剂盒用于提取与青藏高原和西北干旱地区湖泊相关的数据集中的DNA，而阿尔弗雷德·韦格纳研究所的分子遗传实验室则采用独立的PCR设置和多个PCR重复实验以确保可靠性。这两种方法都关注确保DNA样本的质量和完整性，但后者强调控制实验设置和重复性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in the range of environmental conditions covered by the plant sedDNA datasets used in studies on the Tibetan Plateau and Northwest Arid Region compared to those covering 262 lake localities in a large geographical gradient?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在研究青藏高原和西北干旱区的植物sedDNA数据集中，所涵盖的环境条件范围与覆盖262个湖泊地点的大范围地理梯度的数据集相比，有哪些不同之处？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The dataset from the Tibetan Plateau and Northwest Arid Region covers 33 lakes with a focus on local plant diversity, whereas the study involving 262 lake localities spans a large geographical, climatic, and ecological gradient. This broader dataset aims to investigate the effect of environmental conditions on sedDNA preservation, offering a wider range of environmental variability compared to the more localized dataset.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 来自青藏高原和西北干旱区的数据集涵盖了33个湖泊，重点关注当地植物多样性，而涉及262个湖泊地点的研究则跨越了较大的地理、气候和生态梯度。这个更广泛的数据集旨在研究环境条件对沉积DNA保存的影响，提供了比更局部数据集更广泛的环境变异性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might variations in geographic, climatic, and ecological conditions influence the integrity and preservation of plant sedDNA in sediment samples?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 地理、气候和生态条件的变化如何影响沉积样本中植物sedDNA的完整性和保存？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The preservation of plant sedDNA in sediment samples is influenced by environmental conditions, which is not fully understood. Larger sedDNA datasets spanning a wide range of environmental conditions are needed to investigate how these factors affect the preservation of the sedDNA proxy.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 沉积样本中植物sedDNA的保存受到环境条件的影响，但这一点尚未完全理解。需要更大范围的sedDNA数据集，以涵盖多种环境条件，从而研究这些因素如何影响sedDNA代理的保存。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when using metabarcoding approaches to identify plant communities in lake sediment samples across diverse environmental settings?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在不同环境条件下使用元条形码技术识别湖泊沉积物样本中的植物群落时，可能会出现哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges include understanding how environmental variability affects local plant diversity in remote areas and the influence of environmental conditions on the preservation of the plant sedDNA proxy, which necessitates larger sedDNA datasets for thorough investigation.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 挑战包括理解环境变异如何影响偏远地区的植物多样性，以及环境条件对植物sedDNA代理的保存影响，这需要更大的sedDNA数据集以进行深入研究。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can modern plant diversity data obtained from lake sedimentary DNA be leveraged to enhance our understanding of past vegetation changes in alpine and arctic ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 现代植物多样性数据如何通过湖泊沉积物DNA来增强我们对高山和北极生态系统过去植被变化的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Modern plant sedDNA data can be applied to reconstruct past vegetation types in alpine and arctic ecosystems, offering a modern training-set that counterbalances the biases in pollen-based reconstructions due to poor modern pollen analogues. This facilitates a more accurate recognition of local plant communities and past local plant diversity.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 现代植物sedDNA数据可以用于重建高山和北极生态系统的过去植被类型，提供了一个现代训练集，以抵消由于现代花粉类比不足而导致的花粉基础重建中的偏差。这有助于更准确地识别当地植物群落和过去的地方植物多样性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes contribute to the variability in plant diversity data retrieved from sedimentary DNA in high-elevation and arctic ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致高海拔和北极生态系统中从沉积DNA中获取的植物多样性数据变异的原因有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Arctic and high-elevation ecosystems are very sensitive to natural and anthropogenically-induced climate variability, which can shift vegetation composition and plant richness in these areas. The environmental conditions influence the preservation of the plant sedDNA proxy, highlighting a need for larger sedDNA datasets spanning a wide range of environmental conditions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 北极和高海拔生态系统对自然和人为引起的气候变化非常敏感，这可能会改变这些地区的植被组成和植物丰富度。环境条件影响植物沉积DNA（sedDNA）代理的保存，强调了需要更大范围的sedDNA数据集，以涵盖广泛的环境条件。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to understand the impact of environmental variability on local plant diversity through sedimentary DNA analysis?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 通过沉积DNA分析理解环境变异对地方植物多样性的影响为何具有挑战性？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: There is a lack of understanding of how environmental variability shaped local plant diversity in remote areas. The limited understanding of how environmental conditions influence the preservation of the plant sedDNA proxy requires larger sedDNA datasets covering a wide range of environmental conditions to be investigated.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 对环境变异如何塑造偏远地区的植物多样性缺乏理解。对环境条件如何影响植物sedDNA代理的保存的理解有限，需要更大范围的sedDNA数据集，涵盖广泛的环境条件进行研究。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of applying a plant-specific metabarcoding approach on sedimentary DNA for understanding modern plant diversity in extreme environments?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 应用植物特异性代谢条形码方法于沉积DNA以理解极端环境中的现代植物多样性可能带来的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Applying a plant-specific metabarcoding approach on sedimentary DNA can lead to a better understanding of modern plant diversity in extreme environments as it provides a modern training-set for reconstructing past vegetation types. It allows identification of plants to a low taxonomic level and recognition of more taxa from local lake catchments, which is beneficial in reconstructing past local plant diversity.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 应用植物特异性元条形码方法于沉积DNA可以更好地理解极端环境中的现代植物多样性，因为它提供了重建过去植被类型的现代训练集。它允许将植物识别到较低的分类水平，并识别来自当地湖泊集水区的更多分类，这对于重建过去的地方植物多样性是有益的。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What might be the repercussions of limited understanding of environmental conditions on the preservation of the plant sedDNA proxy?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 对环境条件的有限理解可能对植物sedDNA代理的保护产生什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The limited understanding of environmental conditions on the preservation of the plant sedDNA proxy may hinder the accurate assessment of how environmental variability shapes local plant diversity. A larger sedDNA dataset spanning various environmental conditions is needed to better understand this effect, which could impact the reliability of plant diversity reconstructions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 对环境条件对植物sedDNA代理保存的有限理解可能会妨碍对环境变异如何塑造地方植物多样性的准确评估。需要一个涵盖各种环境条件的更大sedDNA数据集，以更好地理解这一影响，这可能会影响植物多样性重建的可靠性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How could the lack of comprehensive sedDNA datasets across diverse environmental contexts affect research into local plant diversity changes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 缺乏全面的sedDNA数据集在不同环境背景下可能会如何影响对地方植物多样性变化的研究？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The lack of comprehensive sedDNA datasets across diverse environmental contexts could limit the ability to assess how environmental variability influences local plant diversity. It may restrict the exploration of how different environmental conditions affect the preservation and reliability of the plant sedDNA proxy, posing challenges in understanding past biodiversity changes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 缺乏全面的sedDNA数据集覆盖不同的环境背景，可能会限制评估环境变异如何影响地方植物多样性的能力。这可能会限制探索不同环境条件如何影响植物sedDNA代理的保存和可靠性，从而对理解过去的生物多样性变化带来挑战。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary goal of applying a plant-specific metabarcoding approach to sedimentary DNA in surface sediment samples from lake localities?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 将植物特异性代谢条形码方法应用于湖泊表层沉积物样本中的沉积DNA的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary goal is to investigate modern plant diversity across a large geographical, climatic, and ecological gradient, providing insights into local plant communities which can be used to reconstruct past vegetation types in alpine and arctic ecosystems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是研究跨越广泛地理、气候和生态梯度的现代植物多样性，提供对地方植物群落的洞察，这些洞察可以用于重建高山和北极生态系统中的过去植被类型。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to create a large modern dataset covering a wide range of environmental conditions for sedimentary DNA research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么为沉积物DNA研究创建涵盖广泛环境条件的大型现代数据集很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Creating such a dataset is important to address the effect of environmental conditions on the preservation of the sedDNA proxy, as there is currently limited understanding of how these conditions influence the preservation of plant sedDNA in remote areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 创建这样的数据集对于研究环境条件对sedDNA代理保存的影响非常重要，因为目前对这些条件如何影响偏远地区植物sedDNA保存的理解有限。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the intention behind using the g-h primers to amplify the trnL P6 loop of the plant chloroplast genome in sediment samples?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用g-h引物扩增植物叶绿体基因组中trnL P6环的意图是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intention is to enable the identification of plants to a low taxonomic level and recognize more taxa from the local lake catchment, as this marker has been widely applied in lake sediment samples and other environmental samples for identifying plants.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目的是能够将植物识别到较低的分类水平，并识别更多来自当地湖泊集水区的分类，因为该标记已广泛应用于湖泊沉积物样本和其他环境样本中以识别植物。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to extract and sequence plant DNA from lake surface sediments in high-altitude or arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高海拔或干旱地区，从湖泊表层沉积物中提取和测序植物DNA使用哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: DNA is extracted from lake surface sediments using the Qiagen PowerMax soil kit. The plant DNA is then amplified with the g-h primers targeting the trnL P6 loop and sequenced using Illumina NextSeq 550 at Fasteris SA, Switzerland.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 从湖泊表层沉积物中提取DNA，使用Qiagen PowerMax土壤试剂盒。然后使用g-h引物扩增植物DNA，采用Illumina NextSeq 550在瑞士Fasteris SA进行测序。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the accurate extraction and sequencing of plant DNA from lake sediment samples?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得能够从湖泊沉积物样本中准确提取和测序植物DNA？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of the PowerMax soil kit from Qiagen for DNA extraction, along with the application of universal plant primers g-h for PCR amplification, and the high-throughput sequencing capabilities of the Illumina NextSeq 550, enable the accurate extraction and sequencing of plant DNA from lake sediment samples.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用Qiagen的PowerMax土壤试剂盒进行DNA提取，结合通用植物引物g-h进行PCR扩增，以及Illumina NextSeq 550的高通量测序能力，使得能够准确提取和测序来自湖泊沉积物样本的植物DNA。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do variations in environmental conditions impact the preservation and detection of plant sedimentary DNA in alpine and arctic lake samples?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 环境条件的变化如何影响高山和北极湖泊样本中植物沉积DNA的保存和检测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Environmental conditions influence the preservation of plant sedDNA proxies, necessitating larger datasets spanning a wide range of conditions to understand their impact on sedDNA detection in remote alpine and arctic regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 环境条件影响植物沉积DNA（sedDNA）代理的保存，因此需要更大范围的数据集，涵盖各种条件，以了解它们对遥远的高山和北极地区沉积DNA检测的影响。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways does a large and diverse sampling set enhance the understanding of environmental influences on sedimentary DNA proxies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 大而多样的采样集如何增强对环境影响沉积物DNA代理的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: A large sampling set covering a wide range of environmental conditions provides an openly accessible data resource to address the effects of the environment on the preservation of the sedDNA proxy, enhancing the understanding of these influences.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 一个涵盖广泛环境条件的大型采样集提供了一个开放获取的数据资源，以研究环境对sedDNA代理保存的影响，从而增强对这些影响的理解。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in understanding how environmental variability influences the preservation of plant sedDNA proxies in surface sediment samples?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 理解环境变异如何影响植物sedDNA代理在表层沉积物样本中的保存可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: There is a lack of understanding of how environmental variability shaped local plant diversity in these remote areas, and the preservation of plant sedDNA proxies requires larger sedDNA datasets spanning a wide range of environmental conditions to be investigated.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在这些偏远地区，环境变异如何塑造当地植物多样性仍然缺乏理解，而植物sedDNA代理的保存需要更大范围的sedDNA数据集，以便在广泛的环境条件下进行研究。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected reasons for using a large sampling set covering diverse environmental conditions to study modern plant diversity using plant-specific metabarcoding approaches?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用覆盖多样环境条件的大型样本集来研究现代植物多样性，采用植物特异性元条形码方法的预期原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: A large sampling set covering a wide range of environmental conditions is expected to provide an openly accessible data resource, which can be used to address the effect of the environment on the preservation of the sedDNA proxy.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 一个覆盖广泛环境条件的大型采样集预计将提供一个开放可访问的数据资源，可用于研究环境对sedDNA代理保存的影响。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to conduct separate PCR set-ups for each of the extraction batches, including a PCR negative control, when analyzing sedDNA from surface sediment samples?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在分析来自表层沉积物样品的sedDNA时，为什么必须为每个提取批次进行单独的PCR设置，包括一个PCR阴性对照？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Separate PCR set-ups for each of the extraction batches, including a PCR negative control, are essential to ensure methodological rigor and to account for potential contamination, which is crucial when analyzing sedDNA from surface sediment samples.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 每个提取批次的PCR设置都必须分开，包括PCR阴性对照，以确保方法的严谨性并考虑潜在的污染，这在分析表层沉积物样本中的sedDNA时至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of using plant-specific metabarcoding approaches in identifying modern plant diversity in sedimentary environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在沉积环境中使用植物特异性代谢条形码方法识别现代植物多样性的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The effectiveness of using plant-specific metabarcoding approaches, such as those utilizing the g/h primers for amplifying the trnL P6 loop, is significant as it allows for the identification of plants to a low taxonomic level and recognizes more taxa from the local lake catchment. This method has been widely applied in lake sediments and other environmental samples, providing a robust tool for reconstructing past local plant diversity.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用植物特异性元条形码方法，如利用g/h引物扩增trnL P6环的效果显著，因为它可以将植物识别到较低的分类水平，并识别出来自当地湖泊集水区的更多分类。这种方法已广泛应用于湖泊沉积物和其他环境样本，为重建过去的地方植物多样性提供了强有力的工具。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What challenges do you see in understanding the influence of environmental variability on the preservation of sedimentary plant DNA, and how might these challenges be addressed?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 理解环境变异对沉积植物DNA保存影响的挑战有哪些？这些挑战可能如何得到解决？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: One challenge in understanding the influence of environmental variability on the preservation of sedimentary plant DNA is the lack of comprehensive datasets that span a wide range of environmental conditions. Addressing this challenge requires larger datasets that can provide insights into how different conditions affect the preservation of the sedDNA proxy, which will help in better interpreting the historical biodiversity data.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 理解环境变异对沉积植物DNA保存影响的一个挑战是缺乏涵盖广泛环境条件的综合数据集。解决这一挑战需要更大的数据集，以提供不同条件如何影响沉积DNA代理保存的见解，这将有助于更好地解释历史生物多样性数据。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, how valuable is the contribution of large, openly accessible datasets in advancing research on the effects of environmental conditions on sedimentary DNA preservation?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，大型开放获取数据集在推进关于环境条件对沉积DNA保存影响的研究方面有多大价值？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The contribution of large, openly accessible datasets is highly valuable as these resources enable researchers to address questions regarding the effects of environmental conditions on sedimentary DNA preservation. Such datasets help in building a broader understanding of how environmental variability shapes local plant diversity, offering a foundation for more accurate reconstructions of past ecosystems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 大型开放获取数据集的贡献非常重要，因为这些资源使研究人员能够探讨环境条件对沉积DNA保存的影响。这些数据集有助于更全面地理解环境变异如何塑造地方植物多样性，为更准确地重建过去的生态系统提供基础。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't understand how the use of the g/h primers enhances the identification of plant species in sediment samples.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解g/h引物的使用如何增强沉积物样本中植物物种的识别。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Typically, plant sedDNA is retrieved by a metabarcoding approach that utilises the g/h primers which amplify a short fragment of the trnL P6 loop of the plant chloroplast genome. The P6 loop markers have been widely applied for the identification of plants in lake sediment samples and allow an identification of plants to a low taxonomic level and the recognition of more taxa from the local lake catchment.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 通常，植物sedDNA是通过一种利用g/h引物的元条形码方法提取的，这些引物可以扩增植物叶绿体基因组中trnL P6环的短片段。P6环标记已广泛应用于湖泊沉积样本中植物的鉴定，能够将植物识别到较低的分类水平，并识别出来自当地湖泊集水区的更多分类群。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I am unsure about the challenges faced in understanding how environmental conditions affect the preservation of plant sedDNA.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定理解环境条件如何影响植物sedDNA保存所面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: There is a lack of understanding how environmental variability shaped local plant diversity in these remote areas. Until now, we have only a limited understanding of how environmental conditions influence the preservation of the plant sedDNA proxy which requires larger sedDNA datasets spanning a wide range of environmental conditions to be investigated.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在这些偏远地区，环境变异如何塑造当地植物多样性仍然缺乏理解。到目前为止，我们对环境条件如何影响植物sedDNA代理的保存仅有有限的了解，这需要更大范围的sedDNA数据集，涵盖广泛的环境条件进行研究。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand the importance of having a dataset covering a wide range of environmental conditions for studying plant diversity in lake sediments.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不理解在研究湖泊沉积物中的植物多样性时，拥有覆盖广泛环境条件的数据集的重要性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The underlying modern dataset is a large sampling set covering a wide range of environmental conditions, which will provide an openly accessible data resource that can be used to address the effect of the environment on the preservation of the sedDNA proxy.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 基础的现代数据集是一个涵盖广泛环境条件的大型采样集，将提供一个开放可访问的数据资源，可用于研究环境对sedDNA代理保存的影响。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the challenges associated with using plant sedDNA to reconstruct past vegetation types and suggest methodological strategies to overcome these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨使用植物沉积DNA（sedDNA）重建过去植被类型所面临的挑战，并提出克服这些挑战的方法策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: One challenge is the limited understanding of how environmental conditions influence the preservation of sedDNA. Methodological strategies could include expanding the dataset to cover a wider range of environmental conditions and conducting comparative studies to identify factors that may aid in the preservation of DNA in sediment samples.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 一个挑战是对环境条件如何影响沉积DNA（sedDNA）保存的理解有限。方法策略可以包括扩展数据集，以覆盖更广泛的环境条件，并进行比较研究，以识别可能有助于沉积样本中DNA保存的因素。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please propose a comprehensive research approach for assessing how environmental variability impacts local plant diversity using sedDNA across multiple lake localities.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提出一个全面的研究方法，以评估环境变异如何通过sedDNA影响多个湖泊地点的地方植物多样性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: A comprehensive research approach could include collecting sediment samples from a large number of lake localities across different geographical and climatic regions, using standardized DNA extraction and sequencing protocols, and analyzing the results to correlate environmental variables with plant diversity as reflected in sedDNA.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 一个全面的研究方法可以包括从不同地理和气候区域的大量湖泊地点收集沉积物样本，使用标准化的DNA提取和测序协议，并分析结果以将环境变量与沉积物DNA反映的植物多样性相关联。
